output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, participants will possess expert-level knowledge in machine design principles, enabling them to tackle complex engineering challenges and innovate in the field.
output.introduction: This course provides an in-depth exploration of advanced machine design concepts, focusing on analytical techniques, materials selection, and optimization strategies for experienced engineers.

chapters.description: Review of stress concentration factors, residual stresses, and fatigue failure theories. Emphasis on finite element analysis (FEA) techniques for complex geometries.
Introduction to linear elastic fracture mechanics (LEFM) and elastic-plastic fracture mechanics (EPFM). Crack growth prediction and failure prevention strategies.
Selection criteria for advanced materials including composites, ceramics, and smart materials. Consideration of environmental factors and life-cycle costs.
Impact of manufacturing processes on material properties and performance. Design for manufacturability (DFM) principles for advanced materials.
Advanced kinematic analysis techniques for complex mechanisms. Dynamic force analysis and vibration control strategies.
Design of robotic manipulators and automated systems. Integration of sensors, actuators, and control systems.
Advanced bearing design principles for high-speed and high-load applications. Lubrication theory and selection of appropriate lubricants.
Advanced gear geometry and manufacturing techniques. Analysis of gear tooth stresses and fatigue life.
Introduction to optimization algorithms for machine design. Application of genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, and gradient-based methods.
Shape and topology optimization for structural components. Design of lightweight and high-performance structures.
Reliability analysis techniques for machine components and systems. Failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA) and fault tree analysis (FTA).
Principles of sustainable design and life-cycle assessment. Minimizing environmental impact and maximizing resource efficiency.
